textbooks.title: Project Leadership: From Theory to Practice
textbooks.author: Pinto, J.K., Thoms, P., Trailer, J., Palmer, T., Govekar, M.

due_dates: Due in three weeks - Week 4 of class

topics: Behavioral and Trait perspectives on managerial work
readings: Zaleznik A., (1992). Managers and leaders: Are they different? HBR
Kotter, J.P. (1990) What leaders really do. HB Review

assignments: MSQ and SSS Software in-basket due

topics: Communication and Coaching: A Foundation for Influencing

assignments: Work on the Skills Development paper and complete submission of the development Plan Paper

assignments.title: Skills Analysis Paper (U Inc.)
assignments.description: An assessment of your strengths and development opportunities in relation to the skill areas discussed in class.

assignments.title: Skills Development Paper
assignments.description: A detailed plan outlining the steps and actions you will take to capitalize on your strengths and improve on a skill you identified in your Skill Analysis Paper.

policies.attendance: Regular online participation is a critical course requirement.
policies.late_work: Please give advanced notice if additional time is needed.
policies.academic_integrity: Cheating and plagiarism are strictly prohibited and will result in severe consequences.

additional_info.technology_requirements: Access to Canvas and Virtual Mentor.

instructor.name: Dr. Zvi Aronson
instructor.office_hours: Available via Zoom and after classes.

_metadata.course_description: This course explores the human side of project management, focusing on interpersonal competencies and skills required for leading and motivating groups/teams.
learning_outcomes: Introduce and describe key skills and competencies associated with leading others in a project management environment.
Provide opportunities to learn about your own strengths and development needs associated with these skills.
Familiarize with key theories and principles relating to the study of leadership and the human side of project management.
